model.interfaces

Interface ISalesManagement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SalesManagement

    public interface ISalesManagement
    This interface models the act of selling tickets and cashing in the payments.
    Author:
    Sofia Rosetti

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addExhibit(IExhibit ex)
      This method adds a new exhibit to the map which stores the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
      int getAvailableTickets(IExhibit ex)
      Given the exhibit, this method returns the number of available tickets.
      java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> getData()
      This method returns the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
      double getIncome(Exhibit ex)
      Given an exhibit, this method returns the related income.
      java.util.Calendar getLastDate()
      This method returns the date of the last purchase.
      boolean isExPresent(IExhibit ex)
      Given the exhibit, this method returns if it is already present in the map.
      double purchase(IExhibit ex, double percentage, int number, double price)
      This method models a new purchase, calculating and returning the total.
      void resetTickets()
      This method resets the number of available tickets for an exhibit, bringing it back to the default number.
      void setData(java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> m)
      This method sets the map containing the expositions and the related available tickets to the given one.

    • Method Detail

      • addExhibit

        void addExhibit(IExhibit ex)
        This method adds a new exhibit to the map which stores the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
        Parameters:
        ex - the new exhibit

      • resetTickets

        void resetTickets()
        This method resets the number of available tickets for an exhibit, bringing it back to the default number.

      • getData

        java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> getData()
        This method returns the exhibits data related to the management of the ticket office.
        Returns:
        the map containing the exhibits data

      • getIncome

        double getIncome(Exhibit ex)
        Given an exhibit, this method returns the related income.
        Parameters:
        ex - the exhibit
        Returns:
        the income

      • setData

        void setData(java.util.Map<IExhibit,ExhibitData> m)
        This method sets the map containing the expositions and the related available tickets to the given one.
        Parameters:
        m - the new map

      • purchase

        double purchase(IExhibit ex,
                double percentage,
                int number,
                double price)
        This method models a new purchase, calculating and returning the total.
        Parameters:
        ex - the exhibit
        percentage - the percentage of discount; 0 if the ticket is a full-price ticket
        number - the number of tickets of this specific purchase
        price - the original price of the exhibit
        Returns:
        the total of the purchase

      • getAvailableTickets

        int getAvailableTickets(IExhibit ex)
        Given the exhibit, this method returns the number of available tickets.
        Parameters:
        ex - the exhibit
        Returns:
        the available tickets
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the given exhibit isn't present

      • isExPresent

        boolean isExPresent(IExhibit ex)
        Given the exhibit, this method returns if it is already present in the map.
        Parameters:
        ex - the exhibit
        Returns:
        true, if the exhibit is present

      • getLastDate

        java.util.Calendar getLastDate()
        This method returns the date of the last purchase.
        Returns:
        the last purchase date
